title: UK weather forecast: Met Office issues 18 hour warning as heavy rain returns
text:

Heavy rain will return on Sunday with as much as 50mm falling inside just six hours.

It is due to hit a large swathe of the UK just days after the country was struck by extensive flooding.

The Met Office has issued an 18-hour long yellow warning, running from midnight until 6pm tonight, covering Scotland and most of northern, eastern and south east England.

Forecasters have warned that heavy rain could cause disruption on the roads, as well as to train and bus services.

Flooding is likely to affect a few homes and business, while some communities may be cut off by flooded roads, the Met Office said.

(Image: PA)

Earlier this week, heavy downpours brought flash flooding across the UK and left residents trapped in their homes on the Isle of Man.

Thunderstorms swept across London, the south of England, Wales and the Midlands on Tuesday, with some areas hit by a week's rain in just an hour.

That could be just the start with unsettle weather set to stick around.

Met Office meteorologist Alex Burkill said Sunday's yellow warning was triggered by rain pushing eastwards across the UK.

(Image: Anita Maric / SWNS)

"It's going to stall and linger across northern and eastern parts of the UK tomorrow," he said.

The highest rainfall totals are expected in Scotland and northern England, but the highest rainfall rate is likely to be seen in Lincolnshire and East Anglia.

He explained: "That's where we could see quite a lot of rain in a few hours, whereas further north it will be longer but not as intense."

By contrast, Northern Ireland, Wales and south west England are due to see sunshine on Sunday, with some heavy showers.

Beyond the weekend, further rain is forecast for Monday followed by a showery and blustery week of weather - with average to milder temperatures, the meteorologist said.

He suggested the unsettled weather theme will continue into November, with temperatures dropping below average.

WEATHER OUTLOOK

Sunday night

The evening will be mostly cloudy with patchy rain in central, eastern and south-east England although any rain will tend to peter out through the evening.

Later in the night it will become dry with clear spells for eastern parts of Scotland and England. Western areas will be cloudy, wet and windy

Monday

It will be mostly cloudy with rain in the morning, some of which will be heavy in the west. South-eastern areas will be mostly dry and cloudy but the odd spot of rain is possible.

Through the afternoon rain will sweep eastwards across the country, allowing bright spells to develop in the west.

Tuesday

Bright with a mix of sunny spells and showers, which will be heaviest and most frequent in the west. Strong south-westerly winds.

Wednesday

There will be further sunny spells and showers, but there will be more cloud and heavy showers in the north and west.

Brisk westerly winds.
description: Forecasters warn that the downpours will cause travel disruption across the UK with next week also unsettled
